thread.title: Teen dies after fall down Staten Island elevator shaft
thread.title_full: Teen dies after fall down Staten Island elevator shaft - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Teen dies after fall down Staten Island elevator shaft
text:
Google The teen fell from seventh story of the empty facility on Castleton Ave. in Tompkinsville around 4:45 p.m., sources said. A 16-year-old boy died Friday after plunging down an elevator shaft in an abandoned Staten Island hospital.
The teen fell from the seventh story of the empty facility on Castleton Ave. in Tompkinsville around 4:45 p.m., police said.
The boy was rushed to Richmond University Hospital with serious head trauma and was declared dead upon arrival, cops said.
It was unclear what the boy was doing at the long shuttered site.
The Staten Island Hospital moved into its current facility on Seaview Ave. in 1979, leaving the buildings on Castleton Ave. to fall into disrepair.
The graffiti-covered campus has towered over the surrounding streets ever since. One of the older buildings at the site was torn down in 2011, but the large structure where the boy fell remained.
